attributes.action: Make sure all disabled people can have the adaptations they need
attributes.background:
Disabled Facilities Grants adapt people’s homes to be safe and suitable.

Current funding is not enough to provide everyone with the adaptations they need. 

We petition you to calculate the annual need for DFG funding at a local authority level, and ensure that this funding need is met.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2011 report by the BRE stated: “the total amount required… is £1.9bn.”

The total funding over the last 5 years was £1 billion - only half of what’s needed.

Though funding will rise by 2019/20, there is no assurance that it will meet the need.

Isle of Wight Council have found that every £1 invested in DFGs could return £7.30 a year in social care savings.

In the past 5 years, the government may have missed savings of more than £47 billion in social care costs.

This needs to change.

Thank you.

attributes.action: Allow Chris brown the artist back into the UK
attributes.background: Since the incident in 2009 when Chris brown wrongfully abused his ex girlfriend Rihanna, he was no longer allowed to enter England, almost 10 years later he still isn't able to visit our country. He has paid his debt to society and publically apologised. He has suffered enough. Bring back brown.

attributes.action: Launch independent UK inquiry into the Panama Papers
attributes.background: Recently leaked documents named the "Panama Papers" suggest  that people across the globe have avoided paying tax.
attributes.additional_details: Recently leaked documents named the "Panama Papers" suggest  that people across the globe have avoided paying tax.

attributes.action: Debate current foreign policy specifically with regard to hostage John Cantlie
attributes.background: We call upon HM Government to debate the effectiveness of the Foreign Policy regarding hostages including John Cantlie, a British war correspondent kidnapped in Syria in November 2012. We feel the current Foreign Policy doesn't demonstrate the duty of its citizens that we expect from our Government
attributes.additional_details: Information on John may be found at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Cantlie and there is a twitter page @CantlieUK. There is also an international petition for those outside the UK at http://tinyurl.com/ktjf313

attributes.action: Change regulations for fathers who lose a child to stillbirth or neonatal death
attributes.background: Currently if a fathers child dies due to stillbirth or neonatal death they are only entitled to what their employer feels is required in terms of compassionate leave.  While a mother is fully entitled and rightly so to the full maternity leave.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that the father should be entitled to take and or share the maternity leave with his partner. These are extreme circumstances and should be looked at as such. When it comes to dealing with the death of a child, your gender does not come in to it. I am writing from personal experience as my son Zachary was stillborn at 11 days overdue on April 2nd 2013.
I was treated extremely badly and inappropriately by my employer after having sick leave due to the death if my son.

attributes.action: Let members of the public be present and ask questions at PMQ'S
attributes.background: The government claims to be democratic and to represent the people, yet when do the public get to talk or ask questions to the people who are supposedly representing us? MP's frequently forget that there is a world outside of Parliaments walls. It's time the people held the government to account.

attributes.action: Franchise to commit c2c to fast train services with stops at Southend stations
attributes.background: Timetable changes which came into force in December 2015 have led to massive overcrowding and delays to commuter journeys from Southend stations.
attributes.additional_details: Trains make more stops at London stations which means that evening commuters face travelling on dangerously packed trains. Changes to the morning timetable mean fewer trains stopping at Southend stations causing disruption and overcrowding on morning commutes. The Department for Transport must require c2c to listen to their customers and return to the original timetable. We call for the reintroduction of the old timetable which included fast services and stops at Southend stations.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of animals on classified advertising pages
attributes.background: An animal acquired via a classified ad is also highly likely to have come from a puppy farm or an unethical breeder – people who exploit animals for profit, contributing to the severe companion-animal overpopulation crisis. These animals are likely to end up in a dog baiting/fighting ring.
attributes.additional_details: Shelters across the UK are reporting a rise in the number of dogs coming through their doors, and every time someone buys a dog from a breeder or pet shop, one of these abandoned animals loses his or her chance at finding a permanent home. Every dog deserves to be more than a classified ad.

attributes.action: Make the next Ofsted chief work as a classroom teacher for a term
attributes.background: The next proposed chief inspector of Ofsted, Amanda Spielman, should spend at least a term working as a classroom teacher prior to taking up the position. Someone who tells others how to teach and run education must come from a position of experience of doing the job.

attributes.action: Condemn the Macedonian authoritarian regime that pardons organised crime.
attributes.background: Macedonia, FYR, a EU candidate country is in a political crisis caused by a corrupt authoritarian rule that has mostly been given support by the governments of the EU member states. The crisis escalated last year when the wrongdoing were revealed.
attributes.additional_details:
On 12.04.16 the president granted blanket pardon of politicians under investigation, people in Macedonia rebelled.. Police responded by beating up and arresting protesters and journalists.

The BBC has reported on the latest incidents:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36041381

More details about the wrongdoings: the  'Priebe report' by the European commission available on
http://ec.europa.eu/enlargement/news_corner/news/news-files/20150619_recommendations_of_the_senior_experts_group.pdf

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum exclusively for 16 and 17-year olds.
attributes.background: The results of this second vote would be folded into the results of  the  general referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Given that the outcome of the European Union referendum will impact the younger generations for decades to come, and that 16 and 17-years old were denied the right to have a say in spite of having to bear the economic and political brunt of this decision, we propose that a second referendum be held exclusively for them. 
We also propose that the results of this second referendum be included with the results of the general referendum as a more accurate representation of the public will regarding membership of the E.U.

attributes.action: Keep university bursaries for student nurses
attributes.background: The U.K. Government is planning to scrap maintenance grants and bursaries that many trainee nurses rely on to get through their valued education.  In place of the grants and bursaries, the government plan to change them into student loans.
attributes.additional_details:
Newly qualified nurses that do an extremely valuable job, are starting their careers with huge training debts which accrue interest, will be paying for their whole careers.

This is a disgraceful treatment of the future generations of NHS staff and should be scrapped.

attributes.action: Save the Environment Land Based Science (ELBS) GCSE from ending in 2018.
attributes.background: Please do not let this generation suffer and the rural sector miss out from this damaging decision. ELBS is a fantastic course for secondary education to offer especially in rural areas, developing the next generation and inspiring teenagers to live and work in the rural community or animal care.
attributes.additional_details: Our school in Kingsteignton Devon has had a farm since 2009 offering this land based science course. Many of our students at Teign School live in the rural community this has been a huge asset in education. As well as offering students GCSEs Rydon Primary school also visit for educating younger children reaching out to over 1600 students. Our farm will now have to close due to this decision, it will have devastating impact throughout education and the local communities. Together we're stronger.

attributes.action: Set one day a year as Forces recognition and Covenant Day.
attributes.background: We Veterans and supporting civilians feel that a special day. would increase the understanding  between   active service persons, cadets, veterans, and the civilian population of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
The day could be used country wide for
1    Public relations activities.
2    Military meet the people events.
3    Veterans  in the schools.
4    Covenant Representatives inform the public about their activities.
5    Corps, and Regimental associations inform about their activities in helping serving, and veteran service persons.

And many more such activities, informing the general public  about the quality of our Armed Forces, its Veterans, the Cadet Forces, and the supporting civilian workers. Which we know is second too none.

attributes.action: Delay EU exit until referendum campaigns are fully investigated for truthfulness
attributes.background:
The recent referendum was characterised by lies and twisted truth, with newspaper retractions and fact-finding services being needed daily.

We need to know whether the British public were deliberately misled, by whom, and by how much, before committing to this monumental decision.

attributes.action: Give Ministers for 'Out' in the referendum equal access to the Civil Service.
attributes.background: Number 10 has announced that unequal treatment for Ministers on either side of the referendum campaign. This is manifestly unfair and undemocratic. All Ministers should receive equal treatment.

attributes.action: Urgent research for AT/RT Tumours must be done in the UK.
attributes.background: Rhiley Kim Bennett was diagnosed with an AT/RT Tumour on her brain & spine aged just 2 years old on 12th June 2014. We lost our little girl on 23rd April 2015 aged 3. With the majority of under 3's being diagnosed, the chance of survival remains low at just 15% or less.
attributes.additional_details:
* Atypical Teratoid Rhabdoid Tumour known as AT/RT for short. 
* Although usually a brain tumour, it can occur anywhere in the CNS.
* It is the most common solid tumour in childhood cancer. 
* Effects all of the basic bodily functions. 
* AT/RT grows rapidly & patients have a fairly short history of progressive symptoms, measured in days to weeks. 
* It has been challenging to define optimal therapy & advance treatment. 
* The UK currently has no standard protocol itself to follow nor a cure.

attributes.action: Publish the identity of aircraft used to bomb hospitals in Syria
attributes.background:
On 29 July, unidentified aircraft bombed a maternity hospital in Syria supported by Save the Children.

As part of the Coalition against Daesh, the UK has data on military aircraft flights in Syria. Where data can identify aircraft used to bomb hospitals, the UK should publish their identity.
attributes.additional_details:
Physicians for Human Rights have documented 373 attacks on medical facilities in Syria.

Deliberate attacks on hospitals are a war crime. Those responsible should not be allowed any measure of deniability.

Background: https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/07/syria-fatal-airstrike-on-maternity-hospital-a-potential-war-crime/

attributes.action: Call for a second EU referendum as the first did not have a clear mandate.
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is an irrevocable decision, which will have far reaching consequences. Due to this we must only leave if there is a clear mandate from the people, which does not exist at present since 48% voted IN. It is vital that there is a second referendum and that a clear mandate is reached.

attributes.action: A second EU referendum including 16 and 17 year olds
attributes.background:
A second EU should be taken & open to 16 and 17 year olds. This vote has been much too close and doesn't take into consideration young people who will be most affected.
Fear mongering in the media has warped facts. The drop in value of the GBP (£) should be reason enough to revote with young people

attributes.action: I want my mum to stay in the UK although she doesn't have a permanent visa.
attributes.background: In August my family visited the UK to meet my sick grandfather. We realised he was dying from Parkinsons and decided to stay and look after him, however, my mum had a visit visa and the government wouldn't change it. The government is forcing my mum to leave me, my sister and my dad. Please help us.
attributes.additional_details: Parkinson's disease is a degenerative disease meaning every time I visit my granddad he loses his memory even more. My family and I decided to stay in the UK so we could spend the most amount of time as a family with my granddad. However, my mum has a visit visa and that doesn't allow her to stay with me. That means we have have to leave my dying granddad to stay with my mum or my mum has to leave us for a minimum of a year. That is very stressful because I love both my granddad and mum.

attributes.action: Stop the CCG from cutting NHS funded IVF services in Suffolk.
attributes.background:
Keeping NHS funded IVF services will impact on so many people's lives by allowing them to have the family they've always wanted.
It would be so unfair to take away an opportunity for people to have a family when they cannot conceive themselves.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.hsj.co.uk/hsj-local/commissioners/nhs-ipswich-and-east-suffolk-ccg/more-south-east-ccgs-plan-cuts-to-ivf-services/7008343.fullarticle

attributes.action: Review planning policy and it's interpretation at local level
attributes.background: Oakland employs 245 and is recognised as a top 100 local employer and also in the top 1000 companies to Inspire Britain. Bromsgrove Council stated that further building on Oakland’s site is not welcome, commenting Oakland is “growing like topsy” and have asked Oakland to relocate out of the county.
attributes.additional_details:
Oakland is seeing its whole existence under threat due to its local Council blocking any building plans.

The Council’s planners argument for refusal is based on protection of Green Belt, in this case derelict warehouses.

Oakland is intent on highlighting the disparity between what Central Government is saying and what Local Government is doing.

To understand better our situation please follow the link www.plannersblockbusiness.co.uk and watch some of our videos to understand our frustrations.

attributes.action: Requesting the British Government to review the FCO travel advice to Tunisia.
attributes.background: We believe that the time is now appropriate to request a removal of the restrictive travel advice which has had such a devastating effect on the country's progress and economic stability.
attributes.additional_details: The travel advice makes it impossible for the Tunisian/British community in the UK to obtain comprehensive travel insurance from conventional UK companies and removes the need for competitive pricing for the traveller. This is restricting people’s freedom to live their lives.

attributes.action: Following EU Referendum, Brexit team to be formed from elected MEPs and MPs.
attributes.background: Most of our elected MPs do not understand the anti-democratic EU (or they would have campaigned for Leave). MEPs know its structures and the legislation we may be pushed to accept part of. In the national interest any legitimate Brexit negotiation team must comprise our elected MEPs and MPs.

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens voting rights in a second EU referendum
attributes.background: Many UK citizens living outside the UK were not eligible to vote in the EU referendum held on June 23, 2016. This was inappropriate and unjust as British membership of the EU has a direct impact on these citizens. In a second referendum, all UK citizens must have the right to vote.
attributes.additional_details: UK citizens living outside the UK for more than 15 years did not have the right to vote in the first EU referendum of June 23, 2016.

attributes.action: Allergen and nutrition information to be provided by all food establishments.
attributes.background: Since December 2014 it has been made a necessity that 14 indetified food allergens including nuts, fish, milk and eggs must be provided on food packaging and on menus where food packaging isn't readily available (Food Standards Agency, 2013). However this doesn't cover the full nutritional content.
attributes.additional_details:
I myself have been a type 1 insulin-dependent diabetic for 16 years, and as part of my condition management I, like thousands of others, need to know the nutrition, particularly carbohydrate content of the foods I am eating in order to calculate my insulin requirements.

Diabetes is a life-threatening chronic health condition and it is extremely surprising how many food establishments are only able to provide allergen information and not the full nutritional content of the items on their menus.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to wear a helmet on trikes and quad bikes
attributes.background: I was in a trike crash which killed my boyfriend, who was driving. I woke up in hospital with serious injuries and two policeman by my bed. They said wearing a helmet on a trike was not a legal requirement. But I don't want anyone else to go through what myself, my boyfriend and our families have.
attributes.additional_details:
Helmets are only compulsory for motor bicycles, not motor tricycles.

Motor Cycles (Protective Helmets) Regulations 1988. 
Statutory Instrument 1998 No 1807.

attributes.action: Lifetime Driving Ban If You Are Found Guilty Of Killing Someone Whilst Driving.
attributes.background: Change the law so that anyone found guilty of Killing another Human being, where their actions were solely to blame for someones death, a Mandatory Lifetime Ban should be part of the Sentencing Process.
attributes.additional_details: Too many people, including the courts, have forgotten that holding a Driving Licence is not a Right, its a Privilege. If you kill someone whilst being behind the wheel at the moment you may receive up to a 14 year prison sentence and a Two year driving ban. This is just Silly. Even if you received a Ten Year Ban, you can ask to get your licence back early. How is that Fair? Google Colin McGregor(Kirriemuir), Alistair Speed(Fife), John Radford, to name but a few let down by the system.

attributes.action: Get Southern trains contract cancelled in the South East
attributes.background: Tired of the excuses and the prices paid for train services on these routes only to have trains cancelled, constantly late and you cannot even get a refund on days Southern did not even have a train running all day. Let us get Southern's contract cancelled as soon as possible!

attributes.action: A Bill for The Protection, Breeding Limitation and Monitoring Law for Canines
attributes.background:
We are calling on David Cameron to make additions in the current law to protect the welfare/safety and breeding limitations of Canines.
Dogs should be given the care/respect they deserve and treated respectfully. 
For far too long they have been seen as a way of making profit and mistreated.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a business or service provider to ban guide dogs.
attributes.background: It is a criminal offence for taxis or private hire drivers to refuse to carry guide or assistance dogs, unless they hold an exemption. This petition calls for parity so the same applies to businesses and service providers. We also call for police to be the prosecuting authority via magistrates court
attributes.additional_details: Currently, unlike for taxis and private hire cars, the law doesn't specifically say guide and assistance dogs must be admitted. This is wrong and leads to confusion. Moreover, other than for taxis. Matters are dealt with personally by the victim, at their cost via the county court. This is not the case for other types of discrimination. We call for a prosecuting authority to take the cases on, on behalf of the Crown.

attributes.action: Make staff happiness an inspection criteria for Ofsted.
attributes.background: It's largely written about in media and social blogs that teaching is one of the most stressful jobs of today. Whilst the personal and academic needs of young people, and the measurable success of schools, are demanded and pressurised, the health and well being of staff seems to diminish.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been proposed to emphasise the need for a long term solution for the drop out rates of new teachers, the number of medical absences as a result of stress or depression and the many untold stories of teachers who battle on with the mounting pressure and challenge that teaching brings everyday. 

http://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/mar/31/four-in-10-new-teachers-quit-within-a-year

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-31921457

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to wear a riding hat whilst riding on the roads.
attributes.background: There are some riders who choose not to wear a riding hat whilst riding on the roads. This choice could be a fatal one and if simple legislation can prevent more deaths on our roads to horse riders then it gets my vote!
attributes.additional_details: The impression it gives to other road users means they are less likely to pass you in a suitable manner. Riders struggle everyday to encourage drivers to slow down & pass them with care and attention. This legislation could save lives. A huge amount of riding accidents involve someone else coming to help the injured party.  The use of a riding hat has been proven to help prevent severe head injuries & it could mean a less traumatic experience for anyone involved with helping the injured rider.

attributes.action: Make LAs fund parental chosen legal representation at SEND appeals
attributes.background: LAs are increasingly instructing expensive, external legal firms to represent them at SEND tribunals.  Often this will be a barrister, regardless of whether the parents of the disabled child is represented.  Tribunals are meant to be light touch, and families are not being given a fair hearing.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents are at breaking point, constantly fighting for their disabled childrens' educational rights, while LAs spare no expense to 'win' tribunal claims.  
http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/09687590701259674?journalCode=

https://onedrive.live.com/redir?page=view&resid=3EA9503A53A03A77!230&authkey=!APLwZXHPVC_Xem8
To redress this imbalance, LAs should either not be allowed to instruct external legal representation, or if they do, they should fund legal representation of parents choice.

attributes.action: Abolish Universal Credit and keep Tax Credits and Child Tax Credits.
attributes.background: Due to issues around late payments, vastly reduced payments call center advisers that are ill informed, sanctions that are unrealistic, failing to deal with claims at basic levels. Forcing people into poverty and debt, vastly reduced rates for disabled children/adults. Plus an Incompetent IT system.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/03/universal-credit-cost-cutting-treasury-benefit-reform-resolution

http://www.theregister.co.uk/2016/05/03/universal_credit_it_could_start_to_creak_think_tank_report

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/universal-credit-will-increase-child-poverty-mps-warn-a7023061.html

http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/universal-credit-cuts-hit-liverpool-11313093

attributes.action: Stop HS2! Spend the money on the NHS
attributes.background: We need to scrap this project and reinvest the money in the NHS. Either that or refurbish the existing transport network. Save our tax money! Save our countryside! Save our towns and villages! Save our community's! And Save our homes!

attributes.action: Legislation that requires all products list their content of aluminium as mg/L
attributes.background: Aluminium is ubiquitous in everyday products. Human exposure to aluminium is rising every year. Contrary to the official view that aluminium is benign in humans, there is growing research showing myriad links with neurological conditions such as Alzheimer's disease.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike almost any other known toxin, there is no legislation to limit human exposure to aluminium and no legal requirement to list its content on any product. This petition asks that the public be informed about their unwitting exposure to aluminium in everyday life.
For more information visit: keele.ac.uk/aluminium

attributes.action: To end linear A-levels and reinstate AS examinations
attributes.background: A-levels are a very important part of a college student's life. It is already very hard and sitting Linear A-level exams at the end of two years is more like a memory test rather than testing a student’s abilities. Linear A-levels have already been used in the past and have not worked out very well.
attributes.additional_details: A-levels are becoming a linear two-year course which means that students must study the course for a full two years and AS-level will no longer count towards the final A-level grade. The nature of this change is to make A-levels tougher, despite the fact that A-level exams are already an important and very stressful part of a student's life. The House of Lords agreed that students should have a vote as this affects students everywhere; however, this was declined, denying us the chance to oppose.

attributes.action: Ask the EU Parliament to vote on the UK’s Renegotiation before the Referendum
attributes.background:
The European Parliament will not vote on Cameron’s renegotiation of our EU membership until after we vote in the referendum.

The European Parliament Vice President said many MEPs will resist it, and it is no more binding than a deal ‘hammered out down the local bazaar'.
attributes.additional_details:
We, the British people, must know what we are voting for on 23rd June.

What does a vote to "Remain" mean if MEPs can reverse such a fundamental tenet of our reasons for staying? There must be a binding vote with a clear outcome.

For Cameron's "emergency brake" to come into force, the European Parliament must vote to modify the EU directive on free movement.

The British Government must request to put its renegotiation to the test in the European Parliament before we go to the ballot box.

attributes.action: DWP to recognise Hidradenitis Suppurativa as a debilitating medical condition.
attributes.background: We hereby petition the government to recognise HS as a serious, disabling and debilitating condition, with the addition of HS as a medical condition on the DWP website.
attributes.additional_details:
Change the DLA application policy towards patients of Hidradenitis Suppurativa, acknowledging HS to be eligible for a DLA award.

Also, having the knowledge of a specialist dermatologist to hand if required for the decision making process, so that HS can be clearly understood when deciding whether an applicant fulfils the criteria for Disability Living Allowance.

HS is a flaring condition, and just because a HS patient is seen to walk into a DLA tribunal, it does not mean that they will not be unable to walk at all the following day or week. HS affects every patient differently, so please help HS patients get the assistance they need and deserve.

http://www.nhs.uk/conditions/hidradenitis-suppurativa/Pages/Introduction.aspx

http://www.hstrust.org/

attributes.action: Government must release all data about EU migrant National Insurance numbers!
attributes.background: It is revealed that UK ministers (HMRC) are refusing to release data about active National Insurance numbers issued to EU migrants in the UK as they deem it would be "Unhelpful to the EU renegotiation process". This is unacceptable & the data must be released well before the EU In/Out referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Jonathan Portes Director of the National Institute of Economic & Social Research requested this information to help the UK electorate decide which way to vote in the EU In/Out referendum. His request has been denied. This is not in the spirit of fairness & indeed indicates a Government deliberately hiding information from the electorate because they feel it detrimental to their preferred position.
This is a matter of huge public interest!

attributes.action: Make all infant formula packaging plain and display clear health warnings.
attributes.background: According to a recent study published in The Lancet, the U.K. has the lowest breastfeeding rates in the world. Breastfeeding is by far the healthier choice for mother and baby. However, currently health warnings are portrayed as "benefits of breastfeeding" rather than risks of artificial feeding.
attributes.additional_details: Formula companies spend a vast amount of money on making their product attractive to consumers and this aggressive marketing undermines a woman's ability to breastfeed. Switching from breastfeeding to formula puts a greater strain on an already stretched NHS as it increases the risk of diarrhoea, obesity, and ear and lung infections to name but a few. The Lancet states that "from tobacco, to sugar, to formula milk, the most vulnerable suffer when commercial interests collide with public health."

attributes.action: Create a UK Register of Arms Brokers
attributes.background:
While many arms brokers work within the law, some unscrupulous brokers are responsible for the illegitimate and illegal trade of weapons, including to terrorist groups and in war zones. 

A Register of Arms Brokers would better regulate this trade, and prevent criminals from dealing in weapons.
attributes.additional_details:
Responsible and robust control of the arms trade is one of the most crucial ways to uphold the rule of law and protect civilians across the world from violence and oppression.

As a signatory of the Arms Trade Treaty, the UK is expected to create a Register of Arms Brokers. It allows for greater scrutiny of brokers and is a vetting mechanism to ensure a safe and legitimate trade of weapons.

For more info: 
Amnesty International https://goo.gl/1FGCO8 
Saferworld http://goo.gl/aX6ljP

attributes.action: To change the Animal Welfare Act 2006
attributes.background:
We the undersigned would like to change the Animal Welfare Act 2006, making it a LIFE ban on any person found to be cruel to an animal.
At present it is only for some, most people only get 10 yrs. 
We feel that if a person abuses an animal once they WILL do it again at their first convenience!

attributes.action: Scan all dogs entering England, Scotland and Wales for microchips
attributes.background: There is an illegal trade in puppies which are kept in inhumane conditions in Ireland.Dogs can be taken across the border from Ireland to Northern Ireland and avoid any Pet Passport control.Microchip scanning on entry into England, Scotland and Wales at entry terminals would control this trade
attributes.additional_details: "Panorama" BBC "Britain's Puppy Dealers Exposed" 16/05/2016

attributes.action: WOMENS EQUALITY -PCOS sufferers deserve hair removal treatment on the NHS
attributes.background: As a woman with PCOS I suffer the effects of hair growth all over my body and face. It is embarrassing and degrading that as a woman I cannot feel feminine yet men are afforded the funding to be female and females are funded for treatments to be male. I deserve the same opportunities as do others.
attributes.additional_details: The nice guidelines do not warrant funding for hair removal treatments like electrolysis and laser treatments. The management of PCOS is not straight forward and generally becomes a weight related issue, however losing weight is difficult for women who have to suffer with PCOS due to the insulin resistant hormones and imbalances. More research needs to be done and this should be an equality right due to the nature of such a condition that removes a woman's ability to feel feminine in society.

attributes.action: All local council authorities must include childminders in free childcare scheme
attributes.background: Currently, it is not compulsory for local authorities to include childminders in any free hours childcare initiative. This is un-balanced and biased. Many parents prefer childminders as an alternative, for some, they need the flexibility. Childminders have to adhere to the same practices and rules.
attributes.additional_details: scma and care inspectorate sites will provide evidence of legislation and training.

attributes.action: Hold an urgent referendum to change voting to Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: The EU referendum has demonstrated that our current democratic system doesn't work. But it has proved that people want more of a voice. We urge a referendum on electoral reform so that our elected representatives actually represent us; we advocate Proportional Representation as the solution.

attributes.action: Call EU suplementary Referendum for UK permanent residents without UKcitizenship
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the Westminster Parliament to implement the law on which basis all residents who have lived in the UK five years or longer should be allowed to vote in referendums. We call furthemore upon HM Government to call suplementary EU Referendum for this unrepresented residents.
attributes.additional_details: According to Office for National Statistics the latest release in 2014  estimate figure was 64.6 milions overall population in UK. Overview of the UK population from February 2016 showed that estimated population in mid-year of 2016 should be 65.52 milions. The population eligible to vote in last EU referendum in UK was 46.50 milions and that mean that about 20 milions (one third of all UK population) in June 2016 was efectively prevented from exercising their universal human right to vote.
